metadata.title: CVE-2024-56826 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the OpenJPEG project. A heap buffer overflow conditionmay be triggered when certain options are specified while using theopj_decompress utility.  This can lead to an application crash or otherundefined behavior.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-56826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjp2-tools - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjp3d7 - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjpip-server - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
libopenjpip7 - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-6ubuntu0.3').
insighttoolkit4 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
blender package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
